Blog.post: I'm sooooooo happy! Life seems especially perky for me at the moment. Though gloom hung over me last night, reality has set in and the sun shines brighter than ever....for one particular reason at this moment in time, my day just got better! Gotta go

Doubt doubt doubt, worry worry worry. That's all I did last night. Despite the fact I'd had an awesome afternoon with my friend. We walked around pike place, down by the pier and went to see the salmon ladder at the docks. A perfect day, until I decieded to become a worry wart in fear that all that I had would be snatched away from me. Why do we do that? The enemy whispers his annoying little voice, or your flesh goes crazy & speaks just babble! The only voice I want to be listening to is the voice of the Lord's. Unfortunately last night, I don't think I was. But the closest thing to a brother I have here came through for me. Last night he text me, "Don't be down, but rejoice. Don't fear, but trust." Those words were comfort to my heart and soul as I realised all my fears were all completely irrational. Isaiah 30:21 " Whether you turn to the right or the left, your ears will hear a voice behind you saying "This is the way; walk in it." The Lord is good. His mercies, His love and His faithfulness NEVER fail us. He will perfect that which concerns us today. So, I find myself reminded to just simply trust the Lord with all my heart and lean not on my own understanding, like Proverbs 3:5-6 says.....and in all your ways acknowledge Him and He shall direct your paths.

A large group of my friends leave for Mission France in 6 short days. It makes me sad...I will definately miss them. Previously I have found times of separation a good thing. When they return, I know that I'll appreciate them more. I can the look forward to the fun times that lie ahead this summer. Fun fun fun! But until then, I'll miss you!

Ok, so don't see Stepford wives. Don't ask me why, just don't see it. You'd be wasting your time! I went with Brett, Adam and Arielle last night to see it...a little embarrassing. But we ended a night with a good old starbars!!
Man, I'm so hungry. When was the last time I ate? a Cathy cookie about an hour ago! So, off to the party I go in search of some real food......
I'm off to Christine's grad party tonight. She just moved, so I have no idea where it is. What a blessing she has been to all of us. Lets spend tonight showing how much we appreciate her!!

1 Chronicles 22:19 "Now devote your heart and soul to seeking the Lord your God." Lately I have found that no matter what decisions I need to make, or what blessing are coming my way, I need to make my number one priority to have my heart devoted and soul seeking the Lord. How can we ever expect to have guidance, peace and all that we desire when we are not doing this? "Delight yourself in the Lord, and He will give you the desires of your heart." How true that is for me right now, but I know I must believe it even when I'm not getting all that I hope for. I think if we take just a little time in our day to see all that He is truly giving us, the seen and unseen, we would be far far more content. I think the secret of being content is grattitude, at least one of the secrets. It will amaze you when you search your life to the smallest detail, you will see all that He is givng and has given you. Be thankful friends. Be a giver, not just financially, but with your time. Are you willing to give up part of your precious free time in order to minister to a brother or sister in need? Be that blessing!

Today I'm not sure whether to feel excited about the current guy situation in my life, fearful or nervous. Fearful because as each day goes by I know my heart is becoming attached. Do I risk the chance of getting my heart broken yet again? I'm not sure if it can handle another blow. But, I choose to trust the Lord. My heart is in His hands. He WILL lead and direct me. For once, I think possibly the first time in my life I see definate hope in this. Sorry not to be more open with you all, but until I know how this will turn out, I'd rather keep it between a handful of us. But please please pray for me. I feel I'm so new to this whole thing of "praying" about a relationship. I've never got to this point before....so keep trusting Him!!

Did I ever tell you how much I love Yac? Actually, I should say how much I love Yac youth! Tonight I get to lead our very first "Strand of sisters!". The alternative to Band of brothers. Why is it so hard to wait? How can you be sure that you're really hearing from the Lord? I know at times we just need to takes steps of faith into the unknown, but when i ask? How am I supposed to know? I really want to take a big step of faith, so do I just do it? Well, maybe any of you could answer me, I'm puzzled...

My parents called this morning, and to my delight they are coming out to California at the end of my stay, then driving up with me to Seattle. Sometimes all that we plan just causes us to fall flat on our faces. We set our hearts on those things that He has yet to reveal are His will. So, I ask you this today,"Do you really want God's will above all else?" It's hard to give up those things we want. But, one thing we'll find as we delight ourselves in Him, He will give us the desires of our heart. We begin to realise that when being led by the Spirit, the things we chose for our lives, are the things that He has already chosen for us. Isn't that awesome. Praise God that not only does He give us salvation and pours out abundant grace into our lives, but He also desires to bless us. One last thought...remember that we don't deserve the blessings He's brought our way. He blesses because of His love toward us. I say this out of experience of trying to turn down His blessing because I knew I didn't deserve it. The point is, I will never deserve them, no matter how good I feel, how much I serve, or how much I love. I, like all of us need to willing to embrace the blessings He's brought and going to bring your way. Eph 3:20 "Now to Him who is able to do exceedingly above all that you can ask or imagine."
"The thing which God does in you whilst you wait, is at least as important as the thing for which you wait for." - by some unknow awesome man of God

Well, maybe I spoke too soon. After a long and eventfull day yesterday, it turns out that I'm unable to get my passport back, or a temporary one to go to France. So, I pack my bags and get ready to head to California to see my sister, her husband and my niece this Friday. I don't know why things turned out this way, but I do know that I need to continue to just keep trusting and obeying Jesus...there's no other way. Besides, having a holiday in California isn't the hardest thing to face now is it? Keep smiling buddies, you never know who's day you'll brighten!

After having stayed up far too late pondering and praying about my current situations, I woke to face a beautiful morning. My usual climb up the hill by my house didn't seem so hard today. It's some what of a ritual for me when I make the climb,and without fail, I turn to see the lake. What beauty it held today. I can't help but remember the greatness of our Creator. No matter how the weather is each day, the view I see is always breath taking. I guess it's like our lives, no matter what circumstances we face each day, there's always beauty in it when we look at them through the eyes of Christ. The beauty is consistent, like God, and how we need to be. The most beautiful place to be, at the center of His will. How can we know where that is if we do not pray? Colossians 1:9-10 "For this reason also, since the day we heard of it, we have not ceased to pray for you and to ask that you may be filled with knowledge of His will in all spiritual wisdom and understanding, so that you will walk in a manner worthy of the Lord, to please Him in all respects, bearing fruit in every good work and increasing in the knowledge of God." 1 Thessalonians 5:17-18 "Pray without ceasing; in everything give thanks; for this is God's will for you in Christ Jesus." The Lord is good and He withholds no good thing from those who walk uprightly. So everything that is good, in His timing He will give us. However we must remember that in His divine wisdom, He knows what is ultimately good for us. When something appears to be good and yet He's not given it two us, there is one of two things. Firstly, it's not His timing yet, or He can see, that though it may appear good now, it eventually will not be. Surely it is better to lose now and ultimately win, than win now and ultimately lose. Anyway, have a great day in the Lord friends. Keep praying...

Well, there's no other choice. I'm off to France. I need to cancel my visa application because my passport wouldn't be back in time for Whistler...so the only other way for me to be here is to leave overseas (mex and canada don't count) and get another six months on my visa so I can be at whistler. It's not our job to try and figure everything out, just let the Lord do it. He will plan your way before you. God Bless Eph 3:20 " Now to Him who is able to do exceedingly abundantly above all that you could ask or think."

There You stand, More beautiful than I had ever imagined. Can it be so, that I have waited my whole life, just to see Your glory? Bright morning Star, I see You filling the sky, across the horizon. My heart can't contain, the measure that I am receiving, that I am receiving. Now that You are here, please tell me this isn't a dream. Now that You are here, this is everything to me, You're the reason I believe. I can't stop thses tears, falling so freely flowing, down my face. I fall to my knees, 'cause I don't know what else to do, standing before you. Your hand wipes away, every tear that I've cried, that fell from these eyes. Now that You are here, this is everything to me, You're the reason I believe.

Having come home after a long day I found myself totally anxious. So many things to figure out, so many things to wait for, so many burdens....so I found no other place to go but on my knees. Do we find comfort in our worrying? Well I certainly don't, but one thing I know is my flesh definately feasts on it. So, finally I remember that no amount of worrying I do will change a thing, other than my stress level. Surely when He says "Be anxious for nothing", He means nothing. So I have no excuse. No situation, circumstance, no person, gives me or you the right, or the grounds to worry. "The meek man is not a human mouse afflicted with a sense of his own inferiority. Rather, he may be in his moral life as bold as a lion and as strong as Samson; but he has stopped being fooled about himself. He has accepted God's estimate of his own life. He knows he is as weak and helpless as God has declared him to be, but paradoxically, he knows at the same time thathe is, in the sight of God, more important than angels. In himself, nothing; in God, everything. That is his motto.He knows well that the world will never see him as God sees him and he has stopped caring. He rests perfectly content to allow God to place his own values. He will be patient to wait for the day when everything will get it's own price tag and real worth will come into it's own.Then the righteous shall shine forth in the kingdom of their Father. He is willing to wait for that day." - A.W Tozer -Cast your cares on Him for He cares for you. -Be anxios for nothing, but in everything by prayer and supplication, with thanksgiving, let your requests be made know to God. And the peace which surpasses all understanding shall guard your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus. -Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and lean not on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge Him, and He shall direct your paths. -You will keep Him in perfect peace whose mind is stayed on You. Because he trust in You. When you feel like you can't make it one more day, ask yourself this, "Where am I looking?". Keep going, keep running the race friends. That's all for now.

Today my blogspot begins.... It's senior night, after making two huge banoffee pies with Jordan, and organising other random things, I'm pretty pooped. What's new? Well after a lady backed out of the france trip, she has donated her ticket to me!! How awesome is the Lord? Kind of crazy when one minute I thought I'd be going to Mexico, then california, and now I'm shocked, but more so, overwhelmed by the blessings He is currently pouring out on my life. When we pause to stop looking around at all the things we want, and take the time to see what He has given us, how can we doubt His ability to supply our every need? Blessing lies in being a blessing. It's not about going in seeking all that you can, but the opposite. Go into whatever situation, whatever ministry you are in, asking yourself, "What can I give?" not "What can I get?." So I find myself pondering upon what could be the Lord's purpose in having me so many miles away from home, so far from family? the answer? I'll probably never understand in full, but one for sure, to be a blessing to His people here in Seattle, here at Calvary Fellowship. Love you my friends...never want to leave. Either way it's going to be a great night!

To begin, let me make one thing clear. We are all called to serve...not to be served. I'm sure we've all grasped that, however, is that all that you do? At times, I think I'm guilty of this, and most likely many of you. It is essential for our growth in the Lord to be a healthy balance of Mary and Martha. Not just serving, but also sitting at His feet. Here's a quote from Elisabeth Elliot's devotional book, "The music of His promises. "Pascal once observed that most of man's troubles resulted from his inability to sit quietly in his room. It is worth thinking about. Today's turmoil and trouble may be seen in God's perspective if we will take time, go into a room and shut the door, sit down, and be quiet before Him. He is God. He is in charge. Be still and know that."

I'm sure I'm not the only one, who at times, thinks of the future and becomes so anxious. He tells us to be anxious for nothing. NOTHING! That's not one thing! So, I realised my need to be open to whatever He has for me. I truly thought that I was open to anything. It turns out that anything did not include giving up being here at Calvary Fellowship. It makes me feel sick to think that there would be such change in my life. However hard it is to think that one day I might leave here, I have peace that He will prepare me for that, give me the grace to do it, if that is His will. Now, I'm not saying that's going to happen, there are no plans to at the moment. But, I think the Lord wanted to challenge my heart. There should be nothing that we are holding onto so tight that He would have to pry out of our hands. So, here I am, my hands are open, take whatever You will Lord. Change can be hard, but in the long run it is always for our best. I used to think I wanted to move to Olympia, but God gave me Seattle. It was hard, but now I look back and see how glad I am that He gave me the grace to be obedient. I wouldn't know all you great people!! Keep seeking His will for your life. No matter what the sacrifice, remember that He see the end from the beginning.

" Trust in the Lord and do good; dwell in the land and feed on His faithfulness. Delight yourself in the Lord; and He will give you the desires of your heart. Commit your way to the Lord, trust also in Him, and He will do it. He will bring forth your righteousness as the light and your judgement as the noonday."

I read this great quote by Elizabeth Elliot today. It really spoke to me regarding a couple of things. One, because it's beginning to look like I won't be able to make it to Whistler this year because I'm still awaiting the return of my visa and passport. I know I must trust that if I don't go, that He has other plans, even if I don't understand them yet. The second thing is I see what an awesome man of God He has given me. If the Lord had not given me a "no" on previous guys, would I be with Seth right now? Praise God that He knows what is better for us than we know ourselves. Anyway, here it is, "Prayer establishes a relationship between God and His child. An earthl;y father, because of his responsible love for the little one, says yes to some requests and no to others. So God does. Think back to childhood. What if our fathers had given us exactly what we asked for when we asked? What sort of adoloscents would we have become? What sort of adults? Thank God He loves us purely. He has often, therefore, said a strong, infinitely loving , no. Thank Him for that. He may say yes to a foolish prayer - as the father of the prodigal did - but that answer will give us a hard lesson, and ultimately drive us back to Him with a new understanding of what our relation to Him was intended to be in the first place. "I have loved thee with an everlasting love: therefore with great mercies have I drawn thee" (Jer 31:3). God's "No's" were some of those great mercies.

With the amount of pondering I've done today, some would think I have nothing to do. Wrong, work just awaits me. I will begin...soon. I think most would say, one of the worst things about me is that I cannot seem to get out of the cycle of putting things off. Then suddenly, like a train off it's tracks, or a huge pile up on I5, I find there's a huge back log of things to do. I do not intend on getting to that point, but I know I'm near. So I was thinking about these past six or seven months. I thounght back to such heartbreak, from which I thought I would never recover. However, I held onto the fact that the Lord always has better. He had a plan for me, a future. Even though I couldn't see it, I now look today and I can see where He has brought me. Repeatidly I have seen his faithfulness to me, and how my failures never cease. How can I embrace His blessings when I know how little I deserve them? That's a question I cannot answer. So, I thank you Lord that You love me so much more than I can imagine, and that You choose to look past my doubts, my failures and fears, and see Christ. It's a humbling thing when God gives you something you have longed for. When you're honest with yourself, you know you don't deserve it. I began a journey this week, a journey that I don't know what the destination will be. All I know is that it's not just his hand I long to hold to take me, but the Father's hand. He who withholds no good thing from those who walk uprightly. He who loves us so much, that He doesn't give us everything we ask for. In His deep and divine wisdom He sees the end from the beginning. Lord teach me to only walk in Your ways. Help me to embrace this journey with joy and not fear, with trust and not doubt. May You be the center of our lives. Over these past five weeks as I prayed and prayed that God's will would be revealed to me, I found my heart saying "Go for it!". But how could I be sure, what if my heart, my feelings were tricking me? So I asked that the Lord would clearly speak to me through His would about my heart. Sure enough, the Lord was faithful to speak to me. "Nathan said to David, 'Do all that is in your heart, for God is with you." Sunday evening it all came to pass. His will to me was confirmed. I feel like a child, entering the world of the unknown. Maybe like a kid at the gates of Disney world. There's more excitement and curiosity than can be imagined. So, it's 4:30, about time to start finishing up and think about catching the bus home. Maybe I'll go out tonight, maybe I won't. Just waiting for him to call. Have a great night whatever ya'll doing.
